      Checks to see if the experience is higher than the experience needed to level up.

      • getCustomVariables

        public java.util.ArrayList<CustomVariable> getCustomVariables​()
        Gets the customVariables
        Returns:
        customVariables

      • getCustomVariableFromName

        public java.lang.Object getCustomVariableFromName​(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the value of a variable with the name given.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the customVariable in customVariables. If null, then don't do anything.
        Returns:
        Value of a custom variable that is found with name given. If name is null, returns null.

      • setCustomVariableByName

        public void setCustomVariableByName​(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.Object value)
        Sets the value of a variable with the name given.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the customVariable customVariables. If null, then don't do anything.
        value - The value that the customVariable's value should be set to.

      • attack

        public void attack​(java.lang.String customString)
        Attacks the enemy.

        Deals damage to the enemy equal to the player's strength

        Does not attack if the enemy cant be hurt this turn.

        Parameters:
        customString - The String that is outputted right before the basic output. Gives more info on the attack.

      • getAlive

        public boolean getAlive​()
        Returns whether or not the player is alive.
        Returns:
        alive.

      • setAlive

        public void setAlive​(boolean b)
        Sets alive to the value given.
        Parameters:
        b - The value to set alive to.

      • died

        public void died​()
        Called when the player died.

        Calls textFighter.removeSave() to remove the current save. Note that the save will not be removed if the player has won the game (gameBeaten is true)

      • getInFight

        public boolean getInFight​()
        Gets whether or not the player is in a fight.
        Returns:
        inFight.

      • setInFight

        public void setInFight​(boolean b)
        Sets the value of inFight.
        Parameters:
        b - The value that inFight is set to.

      • getTotalProtection

        public double getTotalProtection​()
        Gets the totalProtection.
        Returns:
        totalProtection.

      • calculateTotalProtection

        public void calculateTotalProtection​()
        Calculates the total protection from the armor in inventory and sets totalProtection.

        Adds all of the protections of all armors in the players inventory (and defaultTotalProtection), and sets totalProtection to the new amount.

      • getCurrentWeapon

        public Weapon getCurrentWeapon​()
        Gets the player's equipped weapon.

        Returns field currentWeapon.

        Returns:
        The value of currentWeapon.

      • getCurrentWeaponString

        public java.lang.String getCurrentWeaponString​()
        Gets the player's equipped weapon name.
        Returns:
        The currentWeapon name.

      • setCurrentWeapon

        public void setCurrentWeapon​(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the players equipped weapon to the weapon with the name given.

        If name given is null, don't do anything.

        If the player is not carrying a weapon with that name, then tell the player so and do nothing. If so, set currentWeapon to that weapon.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the weapon.

      • calculateStrength

        public void calculateStrength​()
        Sets the value of strength to the damage of the currentWeapon, and doubles it if {#link #turnsWithStrengthLeft} is greater then 1.

      • getStrength

        public int getStrength​()
        Gets the strength.
        Returns:
        strength.

      • increaseHealthPotions

        public void increaseHealthPotions​(int a)
        Increases the healthPotions by the value given.
        Parameters:
        a - The number to add to healthPotions.

      • decreaseHealthPotions

        public void decreaseHealthPotions​(int a)
        Decreases the healthPotions by the value given.

        If the new health potion amount is less than 0, then set health potion amount to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The number to subtract from healthPotions.

      • useHealthPotion

        public void useHealthPotion​()
        Increase the player's health by defaultHpHealthPotionsGive and decrease healthPotions by 1.

        The player must have at least 1 health potion.

      • setHealthPotions

        public void setHealthPotions​(int a)
        Set healthPotions to the value given.

        If the new value is is less than 0, then set it to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The value to set healthPotions to.

      • getHealthPotions

        public int getHealthPotions​()
        Gets the number of healthPotions the player has.
        Returns:
        healthPotions

      • increaseStrengthPotions

        Parameters:

      • decreaseStrengthPotions

        public void decreaseStrengthPotions​(int a)
        Decreases the strengthPotions by the value given.

        If the new health potion amount is less than 0, then set health potion amount to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The number to subtract from strengthPotions.

      • useStrengthPotion

        public void useStrengthPotion​()
        Increase the player's turnsWithStrengthLeft by defaultTurnsStrengthPotionsGive and decrease strengthPotions by 1.

        The player must have at least 1 health potion.

      • setStrengthPotions

        Set strengthPotions to the value given.

        If the new value is is less than 0, then set it to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The value to set healthPotions to.

        public void useInvincibilityPotion​()

        The player must have at least 1 health potion.

        Parameters:
        a - The value to decrease experience by.

      • checkForLevelUp

        public boolean checkForLevelUp​()
        Checks to see if the experience is higher than the experience needed to level up. If so, then increase level and set experience to 0.

        The formula for experience needed to level up is level * 10 + 100.

        Returns:
        Whether or not the player has leveled up.

      • getScore

        public int getScore​()
        Returns the score.
        Returns:
        score

      • increaseScore

        public void increaseScore​(int a)
        Increase the score.

        If the new value is less than 0, then set it to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The value to increase score by.

      • decreaseScore

        public void decreaseScore​(int a)
        Decrease the score.

        If the new value is less than 0, then set it to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The value to decrease score by.

      • getHp

        public int getHp​()
        Returns the hp.
        Returns:
        hp

      • damaged

        public void damaged​(int a,
                    java.lang.String customString)
        Damages the player by the amount given if canBeHurtThisTurn is true, and turnsWithInvincibilityLeft is greater than 0. Prints out custom string.
        Parameters:
        a - The amount to damage the player.
        customString - The string to be outputted alongside the regular output. An empty String will output nothing.

      • heal

        public void heal​(int a)
        Heals the player by the amount given.

        If the new value is more than maxhp, then it is set to maxhp. If it is less than 0, then it is set to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The amount to heal the player by.

        Parameters:

        public void addToInventory​(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String type)
        Adds an item with the name and type given to the inventory.

        The type is weapon, armor, tool, or specialitem.

        Parameters:

        type - The type of the item.

      • removeFromInventory

        public void removeFromInventory​(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String type)

      • isCarrying

        public boolean isCarrying​(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String type)
        Determine if the player is carrying an item with the name and type given.

        The type is weapon, armor, tool, or specialitem.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item.
        type - The type of the item.
        Returns:
        The whether or not the an item with the name and type is in the player's inventory.

      • getFromInventory

        public Item getFromInventory​(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String type)
        Get an item from the player's inventory with the given name and type.

        The type is weapon, armor, tool, or specialitem. Returns null if no item was found.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item.
        type - The type of the item.
        Returns:
        The item found. If no item was found, then it returns null.
